comment.author: 61289374@N05
comment._content:
Thanks people of the SDASM, especially for the publication of those magnificent and usually rare pics of subjects of the Golden Age.
A real treat

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 27309380@N06
comment._content:
Ah, the 1930s, the "salad days" of aviation. The "Tri-motor" arrangement was unique, esthetically pleasing but, not as practical as the designers had hoped. 

If I had to pick my favorite period of Aviation history, it would be the 1930s. :-)

comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: While I have no problem with accuracy I would mention that this is a Dutch machine, so keywords which are obviously German language oriented are out. Panderjäger or Postjäger should be at least the Dutch word without umlauts like Panderjager ! Picture is of course a beauty.

comment.author: 69267528@N07
comment._content: Pander S-4 Postjäger, I think, not Panderjager.

comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: Obviously I am not clear enough, these umlauts are from Germany, this is not a German plane but a Dutch plane from the Pander firm, also sometimes identified as the Postjager.
